news_items.headline: Amazon wants Trump to testify on ‘order to screw Amazon’ in Pentagon deal
news_items.lede: Amazon Web Services said on Monday it was seeking to depose President Donald Trump and Defense Secretary Mark Esper in its lawsuit over whether the president was trying "to screw Amazon" when the Pentagon awarded a contract for cloud computing to rival Microsoft Corp. <MSFT.O...
news_items.img_cap: The logo of Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seen during the 4th annual America Digital Latin American Congress of Business and Technology in Santiago, Chile, September 5, 2018. REUTERS/Ivan Alvarado

news_items.headline: Microsoft cloud revenue regains momentum, sending profit above Street estimates
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> on Wednesday reported quarterly sales and profit that beat Wall Street expectations, driven by the first acceleration of Azure cloud computing revenue growth in eight quarters amid a pitched battle with Amazon.com Inc’s <AMZN.O> cloud unit.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addresses a news conference in Berlin, Germany February 27, 2019. REUTERS/Fabrizio Bensch

news_items.headline: Microsoft beats second-quarter revenue estimates
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, supported by another strong performance from its flagship cloud computing platform, Azure.

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Microsoft to pressure law firms on carbon footprint
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp on Friday said that it will consider a law firm's carbon footprint when selecting outside counsel, as part of the technology company's pledge to remove more carbon dioxide from the atmosphere than it emits by 2030.

news_items.headline: Bytedance's TikTok hires Microsoft IP chief as general counsel
news_items.lede: Popular mobile video app TikTok said on Friday it has hired attorney Erich Andersen from Microsoft to serve as the company's global general counsel, reporting to president Alex Zhu.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Tik Tok logos are seen on smartphones in front of a displayed ByteDance logo in this illustration taken November 27, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration

news_items.headline: Amazon asks court to pause Microsoft's work on Pentagon's JEDI contract
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it filed a motion in court to pause the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from carrying out an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal until a court rules on its protest of the contract award.
news_items.img_cap: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: Amazon files motion to halt Microsoft's work on Pentagon's JEDI contract
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday said it filed a motion to pause the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from carrying out an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal until a court rules on its protest of the contract award.

news_items.headline: Microsoft, Twitter, others urge 4th Circuit to keep 'public charge' rule blocked
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp, Twitter Inc, LinkedIn Corp and approximately 100 tech firms and other companies have asked a U.S. appeals court to uphold a judge's order blocking a Trump administration rule that would deny residency to aspiring immigrants deemed likely to require government...

news_items.headline: Microsoft to erase its carbon footprint, past and future, in climate push
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> on Thursday set a new ambition among Fortune 500 companies in addressing climate change, pledging to remove as much carbon as it has emitted in its 45-year history.
news_items.img_cap: Microsoft Chief Environmental Officer Lucas Joppa speaks as the company announces plans to be carbon negative by 2030 and to negate all the direct carbon emissions ever made by the company by 2050 at their campus in Redmond, Washington, U.S., January 16, 2020. REUTERS/Lindsey Wasson

news_items.headline: URGENT-Microsoft aims to erase its carbon footprint from atmosphere
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it aims to remove more carbon from the atmosphere than it emits by 2030 and that by 2050, it hopes to have taken out enough to account for all the direct emissions the company has ever made.

news_items.headline: Microsoft issues critical Windows security fix after tipoff from U.S. NSA
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> on Tuesday rolled out an important security fix after the U.S. National Security Agency tipped off the company to a serious flaw in its widely used Windows operating system, officials said.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft logo is pictured ahead of the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain February 24, 2019. REUTERS/Sergio Perez

news_items.headline: Microsoft says it will fix flaw said to affect critical Windows component
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it will roll out a security fix that cybersecurity experts expect will correct a highly dangerous weakness in its popular Windows operating system.

news_items.headline: Amazon to seek order to block Microsoft from working on DoD's JEDI contract
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> will ask a judge to temporarily block Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> from working on a $10 billion cloud contract from the Pentagon, a court filing showed on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

news_items.headline: Microsoft CEO Nadella says saddened by India's citizenship law: BuzzFeed
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp's India-born Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella said he was saddened by a new citizenship law based on religion that was recently implemented in his home country, BuzzFeed News reported on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Satya Nadella, chief executive officer of Microsoft Corp., speaks to attendees during the launch event of the Galaxy Note 10 at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn, New York, U.S., August 7, 2019. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz

news_items.headline: Microsoft says North Korea-linked hackers stole sensitive information
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said on Monday it has taken control of web domains which were used by a hacking group called "Thallium" to steal information.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft sign is shown on top of the Microsoft Theatre in Los Angeles, California, U.S. October 19,2018.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Fed Circuit sides with Microsoft, HTC in Philips patent fight
news_items.lede: A federal appeals court on Thursday upheld a ruling that invalidated claims in a patent owned by technology company Philips, handing a win to Microsoft Corp and HTC Corp.

news_items.headline: Amazon files lawsuit contesting Pentagon's $10 billion cloud contract to Microsoft
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc filed a lawsuit in a federal U.S. court on Friday contesting the U.S. Defense Department's decision last month to award a Pentagon cloud computing contract worth up to $10 billion to rival bidder Microsoft Corp.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: Amazon files lawsuit contesting Pentagon's $10 bln cloud contract to Microsoft
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc on Friday filed a lawsuit in the U.S. Court of Federal Claims contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing contract to Microsoft Corp.

news_items.headline: Microsoft granted license to export 'mass-market' software to Huawei
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> said on Thursday it had been granted a license from the U.S. government to export software to Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft sign is shown on top of the Microsoft Theatre in Los Angeles, California, U.S. October 19,2018.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Microsoft Teams surpasses 20 million daily active users; rival Slack shares slip
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> said on Tuesday its workplace messaging app, Teams, has more than 20 million daily active users, up from 13 million in July.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft logo is shown on the Microsoft Theatre at the E3 2017 Electronic Entertainment Expo in Los Angeles, California, U.S. June 13, 2017.  REUTERS/ Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Salesforce to use Amazon's cloud for call center services
news_items.lede: Business software provider Salesforce.com Inc said on Tuesday it would use Amazon.com Inc's artificial intelligence for its customer service offering.
news_items.img_cap: The company logo for Salesforce.com, Inc. is displayed on a screen on on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., March 7, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Microsoft Teams surpasses 20 mln daily active users; rival Slack shares slip
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday its workplace messaging app, Teams, has more than 20 million daily active users, up from 13 million users in July.

news_items.headline: Microsoft Teams surpasses 20 mln daily active users, up 50% from July
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday its workplace messaging app, Microsoft Teams, has more than 20 million daily active users, up from 13 million users in July.

news_items.headline: Microsoft updates terms on data privacy amid EU probe
news_items.lede: Microsoft said on Monday it was updating the privacy provisions of its commercial cloud contracts after European regulators found its deals with European Union institutions failed to protect data in line with EU law.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft logo is pictured ahead of the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain February 24, 2019. REUTERS/Sergio Perez

news_items.headline: Microsoft to probe work of Israeli facial recognition startup it funded
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> has hired former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder to investigate whether the use of facial recognition technology developed by an Israeli startup it funded complies with its ethics principles, the company said on Friday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft sign is shown on top of the Microsoft Theatre in Los Angeles, California, U.S. October 19,2018.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. defense chief rejects Amazon's accusations of bias in cloud contract
news_items.lede: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper on Friday rejected any suggestion of bias in a Pentagon decision to award Microsoft Corp an up to $10 billion cloud computing contract, after Amazon.com Inc announced plans to challenge it.
news_items.img_cap: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper speaks at a joint press conference after the 51st Security Consultative Meeting (SCM) with South Korean Defence Minister Jeong Kyeong-doo at the Defence Ministry in Seoul on November 15, 2019. Jung Yeon-je/Pool via REUTERS

news_items.headline: Amazon challenges Pentagon's $10-billion cloud award to Microsoft
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> on Thursday said it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>, expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: Timeline: Amazon challenges Pentagon awarding $10 billion cloud deal to Microsoft
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> said on Thursday it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>, expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, November 5, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: TIMELINE-Amazon challenges Pentagon awarding $10 bln cloud deal to Microsoft
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it is contesting the Pentagon's award of an up to $10 billion cloud computing deal to Microsoft Corp, expressing concern that politics got in the way of a fair contracting process.

news_items.headline: US defense chief says cloud contract was fair, despite Amazon challenge
news_items.lede: U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper said on Friday the Pentagon awarded Microsoft Corp an up to $10 billion cloud computing contract after a fair competition, after Amazon.com Inc announced plans to challenge it over alleged bias.

news_items.headline: Amazon to protest Microsoft's Pentagon cloud award - WSJ
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc will protest a recent cloud computing contract award given to Microsoft Corp by the Pentagon, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

news_items.headline: Microsoft says it will follow California's digital privacy law in U.S.
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said in a blog post on Monday that it would honor California's privacy law throughout the United States, expanding the impact of a strict set of rules meant to protect consumers and their data.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft sign is shown on top of the Microsoft Theatre in Los Angeles, California, U.S. October 19,2018.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: UPDATE 3-Microsoft says it will follow California's digital privacy law in U.S.
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said in a blog post on Monday that it would honor California's privacy law throughout the United States, expanding the impact of a strict set of rules meant to protect consumers and their data.

news_items.headline: Privacy protection essential to shield human rights, says Microsoft's Smith
news_items.lede: Microsoft President Brad Smith said on Wednesday a "new wave" of data privacy protection and other security measures was needed to safeguard people's rights at a time when "everything has gone digital".
news_items.img_cap: Microsoft's President Brad Smith speaks at the Web Summit, in Lisbon, Portugal, November 6, 2019. REUTERS/Pedro Nunes

news_items.headline: Microsoft rolls out new cloud tool for analyzing business data
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp announced on Monday a new service aimed at helping large businesses put to use the huge amounts of data stored in corporate systems.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft sign is shown on top of the Microsoft Theatre in Los Angeles, California, U.S. October 19,2018.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Microsoft recognizes Greenberg Traurig and Latham for diversity efforts
news_items.lede: The general counsel of Microsoft Corp. announced on Monday that Greenberg Traurig was its top law firm partner in its diversity program for 2019.

news_items.headline: Microsoft says Russia-linked hackers target sports organizations
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said it has tracked "significant" cyberattacks coming from a group it calls "Strontium" or "Fancy Bear", targeting anti-doping authorities and global sporting organizations.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Microsoft logo is pictured ahead of the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain February 24, 2019. REUTERS/Sergio Perez

news_items.headline: Microsoft says Russia-linked hackers target sports organizations
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp said it has tracked "significant" cyberattacks coming from a group it calls "Strontium" or "Fancy Bear", targeting anti-doping authorities and global sporting organizations.

news_items.headline: Pentagon deal to boost Microsoft's position in cloud computing: analysts
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc's <AMZN.O> firm grip on the cloud computing market could be threatened by Microsoft Corp's <MSFT.O> multi-billion dollar contract with the Pentagon, Wall Street analysts said on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Microsoft logo is seen next to a cloud in Los Angeles, California, U.S. on June 14, 2016.   REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson/File Photo
